hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with sloppy dip that's right this

and then we are definitely gonna need

body to our dip all right we want this
to be sloppy but not necessarily messy

and place this over medium-high heat and
what we're gonna do is break up and stir
that meat while it comes up to
temperature and by starting in a cold

but what we're really going for is more

it's gonna happen at the beginning but
as our mixture heats through that salts

we're going for made up of millions

maybe not but if you do have one too

then what we'll do as soon as we've

also toss in a nice big spoon of mustard

people have trouble pronouncing that
it's quite easy and then we will go

wants those newly introduced ingredients

so or until our dip reaches our desired

you and one reason I like to add a good

time it's all those little tiny pieces
of meat get really really super tender
which sounds kind of funny because
they're so small but I really think you
can notice a difference with one that's

that maybe had less liquid added and
only simmered for like 15 or 20 minutes
so I simply let mine cook on medium for
approximately 45 minutes or so until I
was absolutely thrilled with how my
